result.execSummary:
The defendant Dilon M Petzke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  ALL FINES/COSTS TO BE PAID THRU CLERK OR COURTS.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dilon M Petzke

Defendant Dillon M Petzke in court with attorney John k Smerlinski.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes matter is resolved and states recs.  Atty Smerlinski is in agreement and NC plea entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty and sentences.  DE advised of voting rights, appeal rights and felony firearms warnings.

Ct 1:  NC
Probation 18 months
Conditions of probation:

DNA sample to be provided
AODA/treatment and any other counseling per agent

Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial Br. 1.  Bond continues.

Defendant Dillon M Petzke in court with attorney John k Smerlinski.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Proceed to waiver today.  Attorney Smerlinski request sequestration.  State calls George Bonham, Baraboo Police Dept. Detective.  Sworn and testifies.  Defendant identified.  Incident in question described by Detective.  Incident in Sauk County.  Attorney Smerlinski goes through allegations.  Defendant waives argument.  State moves for bind over.    Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.  Proceed to argn.

State agrees to signature bond.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $5,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today, no contact w/M.H. and not to possess any controlled substances w/o valid prescription.
